title: Honey Garlic Chicken Thighs Recipe
description: These garlic chicken thighs are cooked with honey and soy sauce in a cast iron skillet for a family-friendly dish full of sweet and savory flavors.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Meat and Poultry Chicken Baked and Roasted Thighs Honey Garlic Chicken Thighs 4.8 (210) 198 Reviews 53 Photos This recipe for garlic chicken thighs is one of my family's favorites. It's sweetened with honey, flavored with loads of garlic, and topped off with cilantro. Submitted by Eric VanLandingham Updated on March 11, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 53 53 53 53 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 8 (5 ounce) boneless chicken thighs salt and ground black pepper to taste 2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed ½ medium onion, finely chopped 7 cloves garlic, chopped, or to taste 1 cup honey ½ cup soy sauce 1 pinch onion powder, or to taste 1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and brown on one side, 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Flip chicken and add onion and garlic; continue to cook until chicken is mostly (but not fully) cooked and onion and garlic are soft, 5 to 7 minutes more. Remove chicken to a plate. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add honey, soy sauce, onion powder, and garlic powder to the skillet. Stir and scrape the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon to get garlic and onion to mix with the liquid. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Return chicken to the skillet, cover, and reduce heat to medium. Cook until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, about 10 more minutes, turning once halfway through. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a thigh should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Arrange chicken on a serving plate and drizzle liquid from the pan on top. Sprinkle with cilantro to serve. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tips Skin-on or skinless chicken thighs work in this recipe.You can use 1 entire medium head of garlic, chopped, instead of cloves.Parsley can be substituted for cilantro. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 459 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Honey Garlic Chicken Thighs 01 of 53 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 53 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 03/26/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Super easy and tasty! I didn’t have fresh onions and garlic, so I just put a lot more onion powder and garlic powder instead. I also added pre-minced onion from the pantry. Goes well with rice. 03 of 53 Photo by  squirllhunter 03/07/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Made this with my daughter. So good. Also added a bit of cayenne pepper. Just a couple of shakes 04 of 53 Photo by  Denise 02/20/2025 Tasted both savory and sweet. Good combo. The garlic and onion give it punch. I added brown sugar and lessened the honey to save money. Added a tad chicken broth and thickened with corn starch then added red pepper flakes. Keeper. 05 of 53 Photo by  SpryClove6231 02/16/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Awesome recipe! The instructions were a breeze to follow and it turned out delicious despite not having the honey. 10/10 recommend 06 of 53 Photo by  Karyn Hill 02/16/2025 A keeper! This was incredibly delicious! Next time I make it, I'll add some chili flakes for a little kick.Sorry for the bad-quality photo. 07 of 53 Photo by  CaringRice2833 01/18/2025 A keeper! Wow! These taste great. I will definitely keep this recipe. 08 of 53 Photo by  DapperToast3057 01/17/2025 Easy to follow A keeper! Great flavors Worth the effort Followed recipe using boneless and skinless chicken thighs. Very easy recipe, aromatic and super delicious! Made with white rice. 09 of 53 Photo by  PMtz19 01/15/2025 I chose this recipe because I needed to cook the chicken thighs I had defrosted and I thought I had all the ingredients for this recipe. As it turned out, I only had half a cup of honey so I substituted the other half cup with Mike's Hot Honey. Other than that I followed the recipe as written. I really liked the spiciness the hot honey added to the dish.When I started plating, I realized that I didn't have cilantro.So I can't rate this recipe as it's written but that's my fault for not checking my ingredients before I started cooking.With the substitutions I had to make, I really liked this dish and would make it again. 10 of 53 Photo by  TXPILATESGIRL 01/14/2025 Great flavors Very good flavor. I had all ingredients except for cilantro so I left that out. I felt that the garlic, honey and onion flavors were enough. I also cut the honey to 1/2 C and it was still plenty sweet. I served over Jasmine rice and it was delicious! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Crispy Baked Chicken Thighs 467 Ratings Baked Chicken Thighs with Mushrooms and Onions 13 Ratings Baked Chicken Thighs, Rice, and Vegetables 1 Rating Baked Chicken Thighs with Apples and Onions 19 Ratings Roasted Lemon Chicken Thighs with Potatoes 3 Ratings Sheet Pan Parmesan-Dijon Chicken Thigh Dinner 9 Ratings Baked Chicken Thighs in Hatch Chile Cream Sauce 4 Ratings Stuffed Chicken Thighs with Roasted Potatoes and Carrots 38 Ratings Italian Chicken with Garlic and Lemon 181 Ratings Garlic-Brown Sugar Chicken Thighs 308 Ratings 25 Oven-Baked Chicken Thigh Recipes Ready In Under 1 hour 23 Ways To Bake Boneless Chicken Thighs Into Deliciously Easy Weeknight Meals Weeknight Chicken Thighs 1 Rating Easy Baked Chicken Thighs 230 Ratings 9 Delicious Ways To Do Baked Chicken Thighs and Rice Baked Panko Chicken Thighs 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Eric VanLandingham

Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Flip chicken and add onion and garlic; continue to cook until chicken is mostly (but not fully) cooked and onion and garlic are soft, 5 to 7 minutes more. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Return chicken to the skillet, cover, and reduce heat to medium.
